page.title: 08The Hamilton Local Plan 2
page.content: Although a plan of the proposed Hamilton development was not officially published, it received publicity in the{Leicester Mercury}and other local newpapers. There were major objections to the plan. The objections were well researched and concentrated on questioning the need for a large development in Leicester. In 1976 Leicestershire County Council produced a new, scaled-down plan, yet more objections were voiced which resulted in another look at the plan by the council. It was decided that the development plan should be frozen until the planning officer felt that it was vital to go ahead. In January 1983 he made an announcement that Hamilton was now necessary. The plan was formally published in January 1983.
